Description:
Describes the Z position of a node that is part of the order in reference to
the used map

Specifies the roll angle of the AGV/UAV at a given node. This value
represents the orientation that the vehicle must achieve for it to be
considered as positioned on the node

Specifies the pitch angle of the AGV/UAV at a given node. This value
represents the orientation that the vehicle must achieve for it to be
considered as positioned on the node.

Indicates how exact an AGV/UAV has to pass over a node in reference to
the z-axis for it to count as traversed

Indicates how big the deviation of roll angle of the vehicle can from the
node’s roll angle while still counting the node as traversed by the vehicle

Indicates how big the deviation of pitch angle of the vehicle can from the
node’s pitch angle while still counting the node as traversed by the vehicle

Describes the z-coordinate of a control point that describes the NURBS-
curve depicting and edge’s trajectory

Defines the upper height (calculating from corridor reference point) of the
corridor in meters related to the trajectory of the vehicle. Corridor specifies
how much the vehicle is allowed to deviate from a given trajectory.

Defines the lower height (calculating from corridor reference point) of the
corridor in meters related to the trajectory of the vehicle.
Optional z coordinate of the node. If the AGV/UAV operates in a 2D plane, this value may be omitted.
Roll of the node in radians. If AGV/UAV is not concerned with roll, this value may be omitted.
Pitch of the node in radians. If AGV/UAV is not concerned with pitch, this value may be omitted.
Optional z coordinate of the control point. If the AGV operates in a 2D plane, this value may be omitted.
Z coordinate of the AGV/UAV position in meters above the map's defined zero level. May be omitted if the AGV/UAV operates in a 2D plane.
Roll of the AGV in radians. If AGV/UAV is not concerned with roll, this value may be omitted.
Pitch of the AGV in radians. If AGV is not concerned with pitch, this value may be omitted.
The AVGs/UAVs velocity in its z direction. May be omitted if the vehicle operates in a 2D plane.
The AVGs turning speed around its y axis. May be omitted if the vehicle is not concerned with pitch.
The AVGs turning speed around its x axis. May be omitted if the vehicle is not concerned with roll.
Description of the result, e.g., the result of a RFID-read. Errors will be transmitted in errors.
Width of the door frame when doors are fully opened.
Height of the elevator door frame.
List of floors that the elevator can serve.
Describes how long the elevator approximately takes to move between two floors
Indicates whether the elevator's doors are fully opened. Complements openingInProgress.
Indicates whether the elevator's doors are in the process of opening. Complements doorStatus.open
Indicates that the rear door is open. Complements doorStatus.rearDoorOpeningInProgress.
Context of use for the elevator e.g. EMERGENCY
Describes who is allowed to used the elevator
Indicates whether the elevator's rear doors are in the process of opening or closing. Complements doorStatus.rearDoorOpen. Optional if elevator has only one door.

Defines the position on a map
in world coordinates.
Rationale: This field includes parameters for continuous localization (e.g., x and y coordinates and rotation), which remain constant for elevators. Since elevators do not require dynamic localization and have no intermediate state while moving between floors, these fields are unnecessary.

Description:
Contains all battery-related in-
formation.
Rationale: Elevators are typically connected directly to the power grid and do not rely on batteries for normal operation. Battery-related metrics such as estimated reach are not meaningful and do not affect elevator operation.

Description:
The AGVs velocity in vehicle
coordinates.
Rationale:
Elevators exhibit only vertical motion and do not perform planar
movement or rotation. Elevator motion is controlled internally

Description:
Loads currently handled by the
AGV.
Rationale: Elevators do not handle loads in the same manner as AGVs, which manage vehicle-mounted cargo. Load management is therefore outside the scope of elevator operations.

Description:
Describes whether a protective
field has been violated
Rationale: Protective fields, as defined for AGVs, are not applicable to elevators because their operation is confined to controlled shafts and does not involve dynamic navigation.

Description:
ID of the zone set used for path
planning.
Rationale: Elevators do not perform free navigation and do not adhere to zone-based traffic control.

Description:
Defines the position of a node
that must be traveled to fill an
order in world coordinates
Rationale:
In the context of elevators, nodes
represent more abstract floors with
fixed, predefined locations. Because these locations are static and do not change, transmitting node position data in state messages is unnecessary.

Description:
Defines the trajectory of an
edge as a NURBS curve
Rationale: Elevator movement follows a fixed vertical path and does not involve navigable trajectories or continuous path geometry.

Description: Describes the kinematic model of an AGV.
Rationale: Elevators move only along a fixed vertical axis and do not have kinematics corresponding to mobile AGVs.

Description: Specifies localization methods used by an AGV.
Rationale: Elevators do not perform localization and their position is managed by internal control systems.

Description: Specifies navigation strategies for AGVs.
Rationale: Autonomous navigation is not applicable to elevators, as their movement is strictly controlled by internal elevator logic along predefined vertical paths.

Description:
List of AGVs wheels, containing wheel-arrangement and geometry &
Elevators do not have wheel geometry
Rationale: Elevators do not have wheel geometry

Description:
AGV envelope curves in 3D which describe the dimensions of the AGV in
different states (e.g. unloaded, loaded)
Rationale:
Elevators do not have varying, complex geometry which would require envelope
curve representation

Description: Maximum acceleration for an AGV
Rationale: Elevator acceleration is managed internally by the elevator system, making external control unnecessary. Consequently, the master controller does not require this information.

Description:
Current operating mode of the
AGV. Explanations may be found from elevator_state.json
Change:
Removed SEMIAUTOMATIC,
MANUAL and TEACHING.
Redefined AUTOMATIC. Added
DUAL and LOCAL CONTROL
Rationale: AGV operation modes such as SEMIAUTOMATIC, MANUAL, and TEACHING are not applicable to elevators due to fundamental differences in functionality.

Description: Actions that the elevator exposes (including those defined by VDA5050 and custom actions)
Indicates whether the elevator is in the process of moving between floors.
Rationale: Concepts such as rotation or driving are irrelevant for elevators, as their motion is restricted to vertical travel along a fixed path

Description: Classification of the elevator type (e.g., traction-based).
Maximum number of floors the elevator is capable of traveling as specified by manufacturer
Minimal controlled continuous speed of the AGV
Rationale: Elevators don’t operate at continuous low speeds: they only accelerate, cruise, and stop. Since an elevator never needs to “drive slowly” like an AGV, this parameter isn’t relevant to elevator operation.

Description: Two-dimensional footprint of the cabin.
Inner height of the elevator cabin.
Rationale: Elevator cabin height is uniform and the two fields may be joined together

Description:
A field that the AGV can set
to True to indicate that master
control should send a new base
path of nodes (See Section III).
If no base is provided, the
AGV reduces its speed
Change:
Semantic modification: when used
by an elevator, setting this field to
True indicates that the elevator requires a new base of floor nodes. Unlike AGVs, this flag does not imply
deceleration
Rationale: The original semantics do not align with elevator behavior, as deceleration when approaching floors is predetermined and cannot be influenced by this flag.
